post_text:
Our 2020-21 school year is off to a great start! We want to finish a wonderful week by featuring one of our new teachers: Scotti Berg.
Ms. Berg has this share about herself:
"Hello, Everyone! I am Ms. Scotti Berg, and I am the Erdkinder math teacher this year! I am originally from Two Harbors, MN, and I graduated from Winona State in May 2020 with a Bachelors in Elementary Education with a Middle Level Math endorsement! I love all things outdoors, food, animals, and coffee, of course! One thing I love about teaching is the relationships I create with students. Each one is so unique, and I really enjoy learning about them and getting to know them! I am so excited to be a part of Bluffview Montessori!"
Ms. Berg also reminds her students to "dream bigger than yourself." Welcome to Bluffview, Ms. Berg!

As a community benefit organization, the Winona Family YMCA is thankful and honored to be able meet a need in the community by working to fill the gap of Pre-K childcare needs.

Starting Tuesday we will be offering Pre-K day camps from 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. for Tier 1 and Tier 2 workers.

Children will be kept in groups of no more than ten, and each group will be in a separate spaces within the building in order to practice social distancing. There will be no crossover between groups throughout the day.

Enhanced health and safety procedures will include a daily health screening, extensive and frequent sanitizing of spaces, and a new drop off procedure. Each child and Y staff person must meet strict health guidelines in order to participate.

For more information visit the homepage of our website at www.winonaymca.org.

We're excited to do what we can to make a difference in our community!

Here is the framework of our plan for this offering of Child Care.

The hours are 7 am to 6 pm. We start tomorrow, the 18th.

Staff will be here at 7 to greet you, and help your student get on their way. This is a drop in format, and I believe all parties coming tomorrow have shared the general hours of need, so the drop off time is whatever individual families need it to be.

The kids will be broken up into ages just like they are during the school day...groups of 10 or less including the 2 adults assigned to them.

Lunch can be brought by students, or provided by the school.

I believe that everyone that is eligible for this service is signed up at this point-if you are not sure, call the office in the morning or refer to previous emails.

The Three Period Lesson

Barb Amey Scholtz shared a link to the group: Secondary Montessori Idea Exchange.
January 29 at 9:56 AM ·

What is the 3-Period Lesson format? Here's a simple explanation by Catherine McTamaney! Play particular attention the 2nd Period... and for CMSteppers in particular, think about the purpose and place of shelf work - of recognizing before remembering.

Presenting a lesson on solving equations and then sending students off to practice with different numbers is "remembering" or 3rd Period.

Yes, many of our students can do this type of practice and application without sorting and recognizing, but isn't learning enhanced somehow by including a card sort of the steps where students put prepared cards in the right order, where they recognize the appropriate steps before being asked to remember and apply?
